thread.title: Offshore Oregon Wind Gains State Financing Advocate

title: Offshore Oregon Wind Gains State Financing Advocate
text:
02 Offshore Oregon Wind Gains State Financing Advocate 
Renewable Energy World: Principle Power, based in Berkeley, Calif., has gained a governmental finance partner in its effort to build up to a 24 MW offshore wind generator 18 miles off the coast of Coos Bay, Ore., at a site with water depth of about 1,000 feet.Gov. Kate Brown on August 26th announced the formation of the WindFloat Pacific Offshore Wind Advisory Committee in order “to identify smart solutions for Oregon's economy through the burgeoning offshore wind energy industry.”
